Key Match Events: New Zealand won by 8 wickets against Bangladesh.
Kane Williamson retired hurt on 78 after suffering a hand injury.
Daryl Mitchell finished the game with an unbeaten 89, hitting a six to seal the victory.
Mahmudullah hit a six in the final over of Bangladesh's innings.
Trent Boult dismissed Litton Das for a golden duck on the first ball of the match.
Lockie Ferguson took key wickets, including Tanzid Hasan and Mehidy Hasan Miraz.
Mushfiqur Rahim scored a fifty for Bangladesh.
Shakib Al Hasan hit a six but was dismissed shortly after by Lockie Ferguson.
Pre-Game Insights: Kane Williamson returned to the New Zealand team, replacing Will Young.
Shakib Al Hasan mentioned the focus on improving batting and bowling starts.
The match was expected to be a close contest, with the spin challenge from Bangladesh spinners being a key factor.
Post-Match Reflections: Kane Williamson retired hurt and will undergo scans for his hand injury.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the M. A. Chidambaram Stadium in Chennai.
The weather was slightly overcast but still hot.
Bangladesh's Mahmudullah has the highest score in NZ vs BAN fixtures in ODI World Cups with 128 not out.
Shakib Al Hasan has taken the most wickets in NZ vs BAN fixtures among current players, with 37 wickets.
